lyrics.text: Lesson 64, the channel tunnel. First listen and then answer the question.
lyrics.translation: 第64课，海峡隧道。首先听录音，然后回答问题。

lyrics.text: Why was the first tunnel not completed? In 1858, a French engineer, Aimee Tome de Gamon,
lyrics.translation: 为什么第一条隧道没有完成？在1858年，一位法国工程师，艾米·托梅·德·加蒙

lyrics.text: arrived in England with a plan for a 21-mile tunnel under the English Channel. He said
lyrics.translation: 带着在英吉利海峡下建造一条21英里长的隧道的计划抵达了英格兰。他说

lyrics.text: that it would be possible to build a platform in the center of the channel. This platform
lyrics.translation: 在渠道中心建造一个平台是可能的。这个平台

lyrics.text: would serve as a port and a railway station. The tunnel would be well ventilated if tall
lyrics.translation: 将作为一个港口和火车站。如果隧道高的话，将会有良好的通风。

lyrics.text: chimneys were built above sea level. In 1860, a better plan was put forward by an Englishman,
lyrics.translation: 烟囱建在海平面以上。在1860年，一个英国人提出了一个更好的计划，

lyrics.text: William Low. He suggested that a double railway tunnel should be built. This would solve the
lyrics.translation: 威廉·洛。他建议应该建造一条双轨铁路隧道。这将解决

lyrics.text: problem of ventilation, for if a train entered this tunnel, it would draw in fresh air behind
lyrics.translation: 通风问题，因为如果火车进入这条隧道，它会在后方吸入新鲜空气

lyrics.text: it. 42 years later, a tunnel was actually begun. If, at the time, the British had not
lyrics.translation: 它。42年后，实际上开始了一条隧道。如果当时英国人没有

lyrics.text: feared invasion, it would have been completed. The world had to wait almost another 100 years
lyrics.translation: 害怕入侵，它本该已经完成了。世界不得不再等待近100年

lyrics.text: for the channel tunnel. It was officially opened on March 7, 1994, finally connecting
lyrics.translation: 为了英吉利海峡隧道。它于1994年3月7日正式开通，最终连接了
